text: COMPETENCY GOAL 1:  The learner will make observations and build an understanding of similarities and differences in animals.

children.text:
1.01 Observe and describe the similarities and differences among animals including:
• Structure

1.01 Observe and describe the similarities and differences among animals including:
• Growth

1.01 Observe and describe the similarities and differences among animals including:
• Changes

1.01 Observe and describe the similarities and differences among animals including:
• Movement
1.02  Observe how animals interact with their surroundings.
1.03  Observe the behaviors of several common animals.
1.04  Demonstrate how to care for a variety of animals.

1.05 Observe the similarities of humans to other animals including:
• Basic needs.

1.05 Observe the similarities of humans to other animals including:
• Growth and change.

1.05 Observe the similarities of humans to other animals including:
• Movement.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will make observations and build an understanding of weather concepts.

children.text: 2.01  Observe and report daily weather changes throughout the year.

2.02 Identify different weather features including:
• Precipitation.

2.02 Identify different weather features including:
• Wind.

2.02 Identify different weather features including:
• Temperature.

2.02 Identify different weather features including:
• Cloud cover.
2.03  Identify types of precipitation, changes in wind, force, direction and sky conditions.
2.04  Observe and determine the effects of weather on human activities.
2.05  Use common tools to measure weather.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 3:  The learner will make observations and build an understanding of the properties of common objects.

children.text: 3.01  Observe and describe the properties of different kinds of objects (clay, wood, cloth, paper, other) and how they are used.

3.02 Develop and use a vocabulary associated with the properties of materials:
• Color.

3.02 Develop and use a vocabulary associated with the properties of materials:
• Size.

3.02 Develop and use a vocabulary associated with the properties of materials:
• Shape.

3.02 Develop and use a vocabulary associated with the properties of materials:
• Texture.
3.03  Describe how objects look, feel, smell, taste, and sound using their own senses.
3.04  Observe that objects can be described and sorted by their properties.
3.05  Identify some common objects and organisms that are considered to be natural resources in our world.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will use appropriate tools and measurements to increase their ability to describe their world.

children.text: 4.01  Describe how tools can be used to make comparisons.

4.02 Observe and describe how various tools and units of measure are useful:
• Scissors.

4.02 Observe and describe how various tools and units of measure are useful:
• Pencils.

4.02 Observe and describe how various tools and units of measure are useful:
• Crayons.

4.02 Observe and describe how various tools and units of measure are useful:
• Paper clips.

4.02 Observe and describe how various tools and units of measure are useful:
• Hammers.
4.03  Use nonstandard units of measure to describe and compare objects.
4.04  Demonstrate the use of standard units of measure and compare with nonstandard units of measure.  (Teacher demonstration)
4.05  Demonstrate that standard units of measure produce more consistent results than nonstandard units, allowing information to be shared. (Teacher demonstration)

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 1:  The learner will conduct investigations and make observations to build an understanding of the needs of living organisms.

children.text:
1.01 Investigate the needs of a variety of different plants:
• Air.

1.01 Investigate the needs of a variety of different plants:
• Water.

1.01 Investigate the needs of a variety of different plants:
• Light.

1.01 Investigate the needs of a variety of different plants:
• Space.

1.02 Investigate the needs of a variety of different animals:
• Air.

1.02 Investigate the needs of a variety of different animals:
• Water.

1.02 Investigate the needs of a variety of different animals:
• Food.

1.02 Investigate the needs of a variety of different animals:
• Shelter.

1.02 Investigate the needs of a variety of different animals:
• Space.
1.03  Observe the ways in which humans are similar to other organisms.
1.04  Identify local environments that support the needs of common North Carolina plants and animals.
1.05  Discuss the wide variety of livings things on Earth.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will make observations and use student-made rules to build an understanding of solid earth materials.

children.text:
2.01 Describe and sort a variety of earth materials based on their properties:
• Color.

2.01 Describe and sort a variety of earth materials based on their properties:
• Hardness

2.01 Describe and sort a variety of earth materials based on their properties:
• Shape

2.01 Describe and sort a variety of earth materials based on their properties:
• Size
2.02  Describe rocks and other earth materials in more than one way using student-made rules.
2.03  Observe the various components that combine to make soil.
2.04  Compare the components of soil samples from different places.
2.05  Explore where useful earth materials are found and how they are used.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 3:  The learner will make observations and conduct investigations to build an understanding of the properties and relationship of objects.

children.text: 3.01  Describe the differences in the properties of solids and liquids.
3.02  Investigate several ways in which objects can be described, sorted or classified.

3.03 Classify solids according to their properties:
• Color.

3.03 Classify solids according to their properties:
• Texture.

3.03 Classify solids according to their properties:
• Shape (ability to roll or stack).

3.03 Classify solids according to their properties:
• Ability to float or sink in water.

3.04 Determine the properties of liquids:
• Color.

3.04 Determine the properties of liquids:
• Ability to float or sink in water

3.04 Determine the properties of liquids:
• Tendency to flow.

3.05 Observe mixtures including:
• Solids with solids.

3.05 Observe mixtures including:
• Liquids with liquids.

3.05 Observe mixtures including:
• Solids with liquids.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will make observations and conduct investigations to build an understanding of balance, motion and weighing of objects.

children.text: 4.01  Describe different ways in which objects can be moved.
4.02  Observe that movement of an object can be affected by pushing or pulling.
4.03  Investigate and observe that objects can move steadily or change direction.
4.04  Observe and describe balance as a function of position and weight.
4.05  Describe and observe systems that are unstable and modify them to reach equilibrium.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 1:  The learner will conduct investigations and build an understanding of animal life cycles.

children.text:
1.01 Describe the life cycle of animals including:
• Birth.

1.01 Describe the life cycle of animals including:
• Developing into an adult.

1.01 Describe the life cycle of animals including:
• Reproducing.

1.01 Describe the life cycle of animals including:
• Aging and death.
1.02  Observe that insects need food, air, and space to grow.
1.03  Observe the different stages of an insect life cycle.
1.04  Compare and contrast life cycles of other animals such as mealworms, ladybugs, crickets, guppies or frogs.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will conduct investigations and use appropriate tools to build an understanding of the changes in weather.

children.text: 2.01  Investigate and describe how moving air interacts with objects.
2.02  Observe the force of air pressure pushing on objects.

2.03 Describe weather using quantitative measures of:
• Temperature.

2.03 Describe weather using quantitative measures of:
• Wind direction.

2.03 Describe weather using quantitative measures of:
• Wind speed.

2.03 Describe weather using quantitative measures of:
• Precipitation.

2.04 Identify and use common tools to measure weather:
• Wind vane and anemometer.

2.04 Identify and use common tools to measure weather:
• Thermometer.

2.04 Identify and use common tools to measure weather:
• Rain gauge.
2.05  Discuss and determine how energy from the sun warms the land, air, and water.
2.06  Observe and record weather changes over time and relate to time of day and time of year.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 3:  The learner will observe and conduct investigations to build an understanding of changes in properties.

children.text:
3.01 Identify three states of matter:
• Solid.

3.01 Identify three states of matter:
• Liquid.

3.01 Identify three states of matter:
• Gas.
3.02  Observe changes in state due to heating and cooling of common materials.
3.03  Explain how heat is produced and can move from one material or object to another.
3.04  Show that solids, liquids and gases can be characterized by their properties.
3.05  Investigate and observe how mixtures can be made by combining solids, liquids or gases and how they can be separated again.
3.06  Observe that a new material is made by combining two or more materials with properties different from the original material.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will conduct investigations and use appropriate technology to build an understanding of the concepts of sound.

children.text: 4.01  Demonstrate how sound is produced by vibrating objects and vibrating columns of air.
4.02  Show how the frequency can be changed by altering the rate of the vibration.
4.03  Show how the frequency can be changed by altering the size and shape of a variety of instruments.
4.04  Show how the human ear detects sound by having a membrane that vibrates when sound reaches it.
4.05  Observe and describe how sounds are made by using a variety of instruments and other "sound makers" including the human vocal cords.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 1:  The learner will conduct  investigations and build an understanding of plant growth and adaptations.

children.text: 1.01  Observe and measure how the quantities and qualitites of nutrients, light, and water in the environment affect plant growth.
1.02  Observe and describe how environmental conditions determine how well plants survive and grow in a particular environment.

1.03 Investigate and describe how plants pass through distinct stages in their life cycle including:
• Growth.

1.03 Investigate and describe how plants pass through distinct stages in their life cycle including:
• Survival.

1.03 Investigate and describe how plants pass through distinct stages in their life cycle including:
• Reproduction.
1.04  Explain why the number of seeds a plant produces depends on variables such as light, water, nutrients, and pollination.
1.05  Observe and discuss how bees pollinate flowers.
1.06  Observe, describe and record properties of germinating seeds.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will conduct investigations to build an understanding of soil properties.

children.text:
2.01 Observe and describe the properties of soil:
• Color.

2.01 Observe and describe the properties of soil:
• Texture.

2.01 Observe and describe the properties of soil:
• Capacity to hold water.
2.02  Investigate and observe that different soils absorb water at different rates.
2.03  Determine the ability of soil to support the growth of many plants, including those important to our food supply.

2.04 Identify the basic components of soil:
• Sand.

2.04 Identify the basic components of soil:
• Clay.

2.04 Identify the basic components of soil:
• Humus.
2.05  Determine how composting can be used to recycle discarded plant and animal material.
2.06  Determine the relationship between heat and decaying plant matter in a compost pile.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 3:  The learner will make observations and use appropriate technology to build an understanding of the earth/moon/sun system.

children.text: 3.01  Observe that light travels in a straight line until it strikes an object and is reflected and/or absorbed.

3.02 Observe that objects in the sky have patterns of movement including:
• Sun.

3.02 Observe that objects in the sky have patterns of movement including:
• Moon.

3.02 Observe that objects in the sky have patterns of movement including:
• Stars.
3.03  Using shadows, follow and record the apparent movement of the sun in the sky during the day.
3.04  Use appropriate tools to make observations of the moon.
3.05  Observe and record the change in the apparent shape of the moon from day to day over several months and describe the pattern of changes.
3.06  Observe that patterns of stars in the sky stay the same, although they appear to move across the sky nightly.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will conduct investigations and use appropriate technology to build an understanding of the form and function of the skeletal and muscle systems of the human body.

children.text: 4.01  Identify the skeleton as a system of the human body.

4.02 Describe several functions of bones:
• Support.

4.02 Describe several functions of bones:
• Protection.

4.02 Describe several functions of bones:
• Locomotion.

4.03 Describe the functions of different types of joints:
• Hinge.

4.03 Describe the functions of different types of joints:
• Ball and socket.

4.03 Describe the functions of different types of joints:
• Gliding.
4.04  Describe how different kinds of joints allow movement and compare this to the movement of mechanical devices.
4.05  Observe and describe how muscles cause the body to move.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 1:  The learner will make observations and conduct investigations to build an understanding of animal behavior and adaptation.

children.text:
1.01 Observe and describe how all living and nonliving things affect the life of a particular animal including:
• Other animals.

1.01 Observe and describe how all living and nonliving things affect the life of a particular animal including:
• Plants.

1.01 Observe and describe how all living and nonliving things affect the life of a particular animal including:
• Weather.

1.01 Observe and describe how all living and nonliving things affect the life of a particular animal including:
• Climate.
1.02  Observe and record how animals of the same kind differ in some of their characteristics and discuss possible advantages and disadvantages of this variation.
1.03  Observe and discuss how behaviors and body structures help animals survive in a particular habitat.
1.04  Explain and discuss how humans and other animals can adapt their behavior to live in changing habitats.
1.05  Recognize that humans can understand themselves better by learning about other animals.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will conduct investigations and use appropriate technology to build an understanding of the composition and uses of rocks and minerals.

children.text: 2.01  Describe and evaluate the properties of several minerals.

2.02 Recognize that minerals have a definite chemical composition and structure, resulting in specific physical properties including:
• Hardness.

2.02 Recognize that minerals have a definite chemical composition and structure, resulting in specific physical properties including:
• Streak color.

2.02 Recognize that minerals have a definite chemical composition and structure, resulting in specific physical properties including:
• Luster.

2.02 Recognize that minerals have a definite chemical composition and structure, resulting in specific physical properties including:
• Magnetism.
2.03  Explain how rocks are composed of minerals.
2.04  Show that different rocks have different properties.
2.05  Discuss and communicate the uses of rocks and minerals.
2.06  Classify rocks and rock-forming minerals using student-made rules.
2.07  Identify and discuss different rocks and minerals in North Carolina including their role in geologic formations and distinguishing geologic regions.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 3:  The learner will make observations and conduct investigations to build an understanding of magnetism and electricity.

children.text: 3.01  Observe and investigate the pull of magnets on all materials made of iron and the pushes or pulls on other magnets.
3.02  Describe and demonstrate how magnetism can be used to generate electricity.
3.03  Design and test an electric circuit as a closed pathway including an energy source, energy conductor, and an energy receiver.
3.04  Explain how magnetism is related to electricity.
3.05  Describe and explain the parts of a light bulb.
3.06  Describe and identify materials that are conductors and nonconductors of electricity.
3.07  Observe and investigate that parallel and series circuits have different characteristics.
3.08  Observe and investigate the ability of electric circuits to produce light, heat, sound, and magnetic effects.
3.09  Recognize lightning as an electrical discharge and show proper safety behavior when lightning occurs.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will conduct investigations and use appropriate technology to build an understanding of how food provides energy and materials for growth and repair of the body.

children.text: 4.01  Explain why organisms require energy to live and grow.
4.02  Show how calories can be used to compare the chemical energy of different foods.
4.03  Discuss how foods provide both energy and nutrients for living organisms.
4.04  Identify starches and sugars as carbohydrates.
4.05 Determine that foods are made up of a variety of components

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 1:  The learner will conduct investigations to build an understanding of the interdependence of plants and animals.

children.text: 1.01  Describe and compare several common ecosystems (communities of organisms and their interaction with the environment).

1.02 Identify and analyze the functions of organisms within the population of the ecosystem:
• Producers.

1.02 Identify and analyze the functions of organisms within the population of the ecosystem:
• Producers.

1.02 Identify and analyze the functions of organisms within the population of the ecosystem:
• Decomposers.
1.03  Explain why an ecosystem can support a variety of organisms.
1.04  Discuss and determine the role of light, temperature, and soil composition in an ecosystem's capacity to support life.
1.05  Determine the interaction of organisms within an ecosystem.
1.05  Explain and evaluate some ways that humans affect ecosystems.• Habitat reduction due to development.

1.05 Explain and evaluate some ways that humans affect ecosystems.
• Pollutants.

1.05 Explain and evaluate some ways that humans affect ecosystems.
• Increased nutrients.
1.05  Determine how materials are recycled in nature.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will make observations and conduct investigations to build an understanding of landforms.

children.text:
2.01 Identify and analyze forces that cause change in landforms over time including:
• Water and Ice.

2.01 Identify and analyze forces that cause changes in landforms over time including:
• Wind

2.01 Identify and analyze forces that cause changes in landforms over time including:
• Gravity
2.02  Investigate and discuss the role of the water cycle and how movement of water over and through the landscape helps shape land forms.

2.03 Discuss and consider the wearing away and movement of rock and soil in erosion and its importance in forming:
• Canyons.

2.03 Discuss and consider the wearing away and movement of rock and soil in erosion and its importance in forming:
• Valleys.

2.03 Discuss and consider the wearing away and movement of rock and soil in erosion and its importance in forming:
• Meanders.

2.03 Discuss and consider the wearing away and movement of rock and soil in erosion and its importance in forming:
• Tributaries.

2.04 Describe the deposition of eroded materials and its importance in establishing landforms including:
• Deltas.

2.04 Describe the deposition of eroded materials and its importance in establishing landforms including:
• Flood Plains.
2.05  Discuss how the flow of water and the slope of the land affect erosion.
2.06  Identify and use models, maps, and aerial photographs as ways of representing landforms.

2.07 Discuss and analyze how humans influence erosion and deposition in local communities, including school grounds, as a result of:
• Clearing land.

2.07 Discuss and analyze how humans influence erosion and deposition in local communities, including school grounds, as a result of:
• Planting vegetation.

2.07 Discuss and analyze how humans influence erosion and deposition in local communities, including school grounds, as a result of:
• Building dams.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 3:  The learner will conduct investigations and use appropriate technology to build an understanding of weather and climate.

children.text:
3.01 Investigate the water cycle including the processes of:
• Evaporation.

3.01 Investigate the water cycle including the processes of:
• Condensation.

3.01 Investigate the water cycle including the processes of:
• Precipitation.

3.01 Investigate the water cycle including the processes of:
• Run-off.

3.02 Discuss and determine how the following are affected by predictable patterns of weather:
• Temperature.

3.02 Discuss and determine how the following are affected by predictable patterns of weather:
• Wind direction and speed.

3.02 Discuss and determine how the following are affected by predictable patterns of weather:
• Precipitation.

3.02 Discuss and determine how the following are affected by predictable patterns of weather:
• Cloud cover.

3.02 Discuss and determine how the following are affected by predictable patterns of weather:
• Air pressure.
3.03  Describe and analyze the formation of various types of clouds and discuss their relations to weather systems.
3.04  Explain how global atmospheric movement patterns affect local weather.
3.05  Compile and use weather data to establish a climate record and reveal any trends.

3.06 Discuss and determine the influence of geography on weather and climate:
• Mountains.

3.06 Discuss and determine the influence of geography on weather and climate:
• Sea breezes.

3.06 Discuss and determine the influence of geography on weather and climate:
• Water bodies.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will conduct investigations and use appropriate technologies to build an understanding of forces and motion in technological designs.

children.text: 4.01  Determine the motion of an object by following and measuring its position over time.
4.02  Evaluate how pushing and pulling forces can change the position and motion of an object.
4.03  Explain how energy is needed to make machines move.• Moving air.

4.03 Explain how energy is needed to make machines move.
•Gravity.
4.04  Determine that an unbalanced force is needed to move an object or change its direction.

4.05 Determine factors that affect motion including:
• Force.

4.05 Determine factors that affect motion including:
• Friction.

4.05 Determine factors that affect motion including:
• Inertia.

4.05 Determine factors that affect motion including:
• Momentum.
4.06  Build and use a model to solve a mechanical design problem.• Devise a test for the model.

4.06 Build and use a model to solve a mechanical design problem.
• Evaluate the results of a test.
4.07  Determine how people use simple machines to solve problems.

text: COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will demonstrate an understanding of technological design.

• Artifact or hardward

2.01 Explore evidence that "technology" has many definitions.
• Methodology or technique.

• System of production.

3.01 Assess evidence to interpret the order and impact of events in the geologic past:
• Division of Geologic Time.
3.02  Evaluate the geologic history of North Carolina.
COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will build an understanding of the hydrosphere and its interactions and influences on the lithosphere, the atmosphere, and environmental quality.

4.01 Evaluate erosion and depositional processes:
• Formation of stream channels with respect to the work being done by the stream (i.e. down-cutting, lateral erosion, and transportation).

4.01 Evaluate erosion and depositional processes:
• Nature and characteristics of sediments.

4.01 Evaluate erosion and depositional processes:
• Effects on water quality.

4.01 Evaluate erosion and depositional processes:
• Effect of human choices on the rate of erosion.

4.02 Analyze mechanisms for generating ocean currents and upwelling:
• Temperature.

4.02 Analyze mechanisms for generating ocean currents and upwelling:
• Coriolis effect.

4.02 Analyze mechanisms for generating ocean currents and upwelling:
• Climatic influence.

4.03 Analyze the mechanisms that produce the various types of shorelines and their resultant landforms:
• Nature of underlying geology.

4.03 Analyze the mechanisms that produce the various types of shorelines and their resultant landforms:
• Long and short term sea-level history.

4.03 Analyze the mechanisms that produce the various types of shorelines and their resultant landforms:
• Formation and breaking of waves on adjacent topography.

4.03 Analyze the mechanisms that produce the various types of shorelines and their resultant landforms:
• Human impact.

4.04 Evaluate water resources:
• Storage and movement of groundwater.

4.04 Evaluate water resources:
• Ecological services provided by the ocean.

4.04 Evaluate water resources:
• Environmental impacts of a growing human population.

4.04 Evaluate water resources:
• Causes of natural and manmade contamination.

4.05 Investigate and analyze environmental issues and solution for North Carolina's river basins, wetlands, and tidal environments:
• Water quality.

4.05 Investigate and analyze environmental issues and solutions for North Carolina's river basins, wetlands, and tidal environments:
• Shoreline changes.

4.05 Investigate and analyze environmental issues and solutions for North Carolina's river basins, wetlands, and tidal environments:
• Habitat preservation.
COMPETENCY GOAL 5:  The learner will build an understanding of the dynamics and composition of the atmosphere and its local and global processes influencing climate and air quality.

5.01 Analyze air masses and the life cycle of weather systems:
• Planetary wind belts.

5.01 Analyze air masses and the life cycle of weather systems:
• Air masses.

5.01 Analyze air masses and the life cycle of weather systems:
• Frontal systems.

5.01 Analyze air masses and the life cycle of weather systems:
• Cyclonic systems.

5.02 Evaluate meteorological observing, analysis, and prediction:
• Worldwide observing systems.

5.02 Evaluate meteorological observing, analysis, and prediction:
• Meteorological data depiction.

5.03 Analyze global atmospheric changes including changes in CO2, CH4, and stratospheric 03, and the consequences of these changes:
• Climate change.

5.03 Analyze global atmospheric changes including changes in CO2, CH4, and stratospheric 03, and the consequences of these changes:
• Changes in weather patterns.

5.03 Analyze global atmospheric changes including changes in CO2, CH4, and stratospheric 03, and the consequences of these changes:
• Increasing ultraviolet radiation.

5.03 Analyze global atmospheric changes including changes in CO2, CH4, and stratospheric 03, and the consequences of these changes:
• Sea level changes.
COMPETENCY GOAL 6:  The learner will acquire an understanding of the earth in the solar system and its position in the universe.
6.01  Analyze the theories of the formation of the universe and solar system.

6.02 Analyze planetary motion and the physical laws that explain that motion:
• Rotation.

6.02 Analyze planetary motion and the physical laws that explain that motion:
• Revolution.

6.02 Analyze planetary motion and the physical laws that explain that motion:
• Apparent diurnal motions of the stars, sun and moon.

6.02 Analyze planetary motion and the physical laws that explain that motion:
• Effects of the tilt of the earth's axis.

6.03 Examine the sources of stellar energies.
• Life cycle of stars.

6.03 Examine the sources of stellar energies.
• Hertzsprung - Russell Diagram.
6.04  Assess the spectra generated by stars and our sun as indicators of motion and composition (the Doppler effect).

6.05 Evaluate astronomers' use of various technologies to extend their senses:
• Optical telescopes.

6.05 Evaluate astronomers' use of various technologies to extend their senses:
• Cameras.

6.05 Evaluate astronomers' use of various technologies to extend their senses:
• Radio telescopes.

6.05 Evaluate astronomers' use of various technologies to extend their senses:
• Spectroscope.

text: PHYSICAL SCIENCE

children.text: COMPETENCY GOAL 1:  The learner will develop abilities necessary to do and understand scientific inquiry.
1.01  Identify questions and problems that can be answered through scientific investigations.

1.02 Design and conduct scientific investigations to answer questions about the physical world.
• Create testable hypotheses.

1.02 Design and conduct scientific investigations to answer questions about the physical world.
• Identify variables.

1.02 Design and conduct scientific investigations to answer questions about the physical world.
• Use a control or comparison group when appropriate.

1.02 Design and conduct scientific investigations to answer questions about the physical world.
• Select and use appropriate measurement tools.

1.02 Design and conduct scientific investigations to answer questions about the physical world.
• Collect and record data.

1.02 Design and conduct scientific investigations to answer questions about the physical world.
• Organize data into charts and graphs.

1.02 Design and conduct scientific investigations to answer questions about the physical world.
• Analyze and interpret data.

1.02 Design and conduct scientific investigations to answer questions about the physical world.
• Communicate findings.

1.03 Formulate and revise scientific explanations and models using logic and evidence to:
• Explain observations.

1.03 Formulate and revise scientific explanations and models using logic and evidence to:
• Make inferences and predictions.

1.03 Formulate and revise scientific explanations and models using logic and evidence to:
• Explain the relationship between evidence and explanation.

1.04 Apply safety procedures in the laboratory and in field studies:
• Recognize and avoid potential hazards.

1.04 Apply safety procedures in the laboratory and in field studies:
• Safely manipulate materials and equipment needed for scientific investigations.

1.05 Analyze reports of scientific investigations from an informed scientifically literate viewpoint including considerations of:
• Appropriate sample.

1.05 Analyze reports of scientific investigations from an informed scientifically literate viewpoint including considerations of:
• Adequacy of experimental controls.

1.05 Analyze reports of scientific investigations from an informed scientifically literate viewpoint including considerations of:
• Replication of findings.

1.05 Analyze reports of scientific investigations from an informed scientifically literate viewpoint including considerations of:
• Alternative interpretations of the data.
COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will construct an understanding of forces and motion.

2.01 Measure and mathematically/graphically analyze motion:
• Frame of reference (all motion is relative -there is no motionless frame).

2.01 Measure and mathematically/graphically analyze motion:
• Uniform motion.

2.01 Measure and mathematically/graphically analyze motion:
• Acceleration.

2.02 Investigate and analyze forces as interactions that can change motion:
• In the absence of a force, an object in motion will remain in motion or an object at rest will remain at rest until acted on by an unbalanced force.

2.02 Investigate and analyze forces as interactions that can change motion:
• Change in motion of an object (acceleration) is directly proportional to the unbalanced outside force and inversely proportional to the mass.

2.02 Investigate and analyze forces as interactions that can change motion:
• Whenever one object exerts a force on another, an equal and opposite force is exerted by the second or the first.
COMPETENCY GOAL 3:  The learner will analyze energy and its conservation.

3.01 Investigate and analyze storage of energy:
• Kinetic energy.

3.01 Investigate and analyze storage of energy:
• Potential energies: gravitational, chemical, electrical, elastic, nuclear.

3.01 Investigate and analyze storage of energy:
• Thermal energy.

3.02 Investigate and analyze transfer of energy by work:
• Force.

3.02 Investigate and analyze transfer of energy by work:
• Distance.

3.03 Investigate and anayze transfer of energy by heating.
• Thermal energy flows from a higher to a lower temperature.

3.03 Investigate and analyze transfer of energy by heating.
• Energy will not spontaneously flow from a lower temperature to a higher temperature.

3.03 Investigate and analyze transfer of energy by heating.
• It is impossible to build a machine that does nothing but convert thermal energy into useful work.

3.04 Investigate and analyze the transfer of energy by waves:
• General characteristics of waves: amplitude, frequency, period, wavelength, velocity of propagation.

3.04 Investigate and analyze the transfer of energy by waves:
• Mechanical waves.

3.04 Investigate and analyze the transfer of energy by waves:
• Sound waves.

3.04 Investigate and analyze the transfer of energy by waves:
• Electromagnetic waves (radiation).
COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will construct an understanding of electricity and magnetism.

4.01 Investigate and analyze the nature of static electricity and the conservation of electrical charge:
• Positive and negative charges.

4.01 Investigate and analyze the nature of static electricity and the conservation of electrical charge:
• Opposite charges attract and like charges repel.

4.01 Investigate and analyze the nature of static electricity and the conservation of electrical charge:
• Analyze the electrical charging of objects due to the transfer of charge.

4.02 Investigate and analyze direct current electrical circuits:
• Ohm's Law.

4.02 Investigate and analyze direct current electrical circuits:
• Series circuits.

4.02 Investigate and analyze direct current electrical circuits:
• Parallel circuits.

4.03 Investigate and analyze magnetism and the practical applications of the characteristics of magnets.
• Permanent magnets.

4.03 Investigate and analyze magentism and the practical applications of the characteristics of magnets.
• Electromagnetism.

4.03 Investigate and analyze magentism and the practical applications of the characteristics of magnets.
• Movement of electrical charges.
COMPETENCY GOAL 5:  The learner will build an understanding of the structure and properties of matter.

5.01 Develop an understanding of how scientific processes have led to the current atomic theory.
• Dalton's atomic theory.

5.01 Develop an understanding of how scientific processes have led to the current atomic theorry.
• J.J. Thomson's model of the atom.

5.01 Develop an understanding of how scientific processes have led to the current atomic theorry.
• Rutherford's gold foil experiment.

5.01 Develop an understanding of how scientific processes have led to the current atomic theorry.
• Bohr's planetary model.

5.01 Develop an understanding of how scientific processes have led to the current atomic theorry.
• Electron cloud model.

5.02 Examine the nature of atomic structure:
• Protons.

5.02 Examine the nature of atomic structure:
• Neutrons.

5.02 Examine the nature of atomic structure:
• Electrons.

5.02 Examine the nature of atomic structure:
• Atomic mass.

5.02 Examine the nature of atomic structure:
• Atomic number.

5.02 Examine the nature of atomic structure:
• Isotopes.

5.03 Identify substances through the investigation of physical properties:
• Density.

5.03 Identify substances through the investigation of physical properties:
• Melting point.

5.03 Identify substances through the investigation of physical properties:
• Boiling point.
COMPETENCY GOAL 6:  The learner will build an understanding of regularities in chemistry.

6.01 Analyze the periodic trends in the physical and chemical properties of elements.
• Groups (families).

6.01 Analyze the periodic trends in the physical and chemical properties of elements.
• Periods.

6.02 Investigate and analyze the formation and nomenclature of simple inorganic compounds.
• Ionic bonds (including oxidation numbers).

6.02 Investigate and analyze the formation and nomenclature of simple inorganic compounds.
• Covalent bonds.

6.02 Investigate and analyze the formation and nomenclature of simple inorganic compounds.
• Metallic bonds.

6.03 Identify the reactants and products of chemical reactions and balance simple equations of various types:
• Single replacement.

6.03 Identify the reactants and products of chemical reactions and balance simple equations of various types:
• Double replacement.

6.03 Identify the reactants and products of chemical reactions and balance simple equations of various types:
• Decomposition.

6.03 Identify the reactants and products of chemical reactions and balance simple equations of various types:
• Synthesis.

6.04 Measure and analyze the indicators of chemical change including:
• Development of a gas.

6.04 Measure and analyze the indicators of chemical change including:
• Formation of a precipitate.

6.04 Measure and analyze the indicators of chemical change including:
• Release/absorption of energy (heat or light).

6.05 Investigate and analyze the properties and composition of solutions:
• Solubility curves.

6.05 Investigate and analyze the properties and composition of solutions:
• Concentration.

6.05 Investigate and analyze the properties and composition of solutions:
• Polarity.

6.05 Investigate and analyze the properties and composition of solutions:
• pH scale.

6.05 Investigate and analyze the properties and composition of solutions:
• Electrical conductivity.

6.06 Describe and explain radioacitivity and its practical application as an alternative energy source:
• Alpha, beta, and gamma decay.

6.06 Describe and explain radioactivity and its practical application as an alternative energy source:
• Fission.

6.06 Describe and explain radioactivity and its practical application as an alternative energy source:
• Fusion.

6.06 Describe and explain radioactivity and its practical application as an alternative energy source:
• Nuclear waste.

COMPETENCY GOAL 2:  The learner will build an understanding of linear motion.

2.01 Analyze velocity as a rate of change of position:
• Average velocity.

2.01 Analyze velocity as a rate of change of position:
• Instantaneous velocity.

2.02 Compare and contrast as scalar and vector quantities:
  • Speed and velocity.
  • Distance and displacement.
2.03  Analyze acceleration as rate of change in velocity.

2.04 Using graphical and mathematical tools, design and conduct investigations of linear motion and the relationships among:
• Position.

2.04 Using graphical and mathematical tools, design and conduct investigations of linear motion and the relationships among:
• Average velocity.

2.04 Using graphical and mathematical tools, design and conduct investigations of linear motion and the relationships among:
• Instantaneous velocity.

2.04 Using graphical and mathematical tools, design and conduct investigations of linear motion and the relationships among:
• Acceleration.

2.04 Using graphical and mathematical tools, design and conduct investigations of linear motion and the relationships among:
• Time
COMPETENCY GOAL 3:  The learner will build an understanding of two-dimensional motion including circular motion.
3.01  Analyze and evaluate projectile motion in a defined frame of reference.
3.02  Design and conduct investigations of two-dimensional motion of objects.
3.03  Analyze and evaluate independence of the vector components of projectile.
3.04  Evaluate, measure, and analyze circular motion.
3.05  Analyze and evaluate the nature of centripetal forces.

3.06 Investigate, evaluate and analyze the relationship among:
• Centripetal force.

3.06 Investigate, evaluate and analyze the relationship among:
• Centripetal acceleration.

3.06 Investigate, evaluate and analyze the relationship among:
• Mass.

3.06 Investigate, evaluate and analyze the relationship among:
• Velocity.

3.06 Investigate, evaluate and analyze the relationship among:
• Radius.
COMPETENCY GOAL 4:  The learner will develop an understanding of forces and Newton's Laws of Motion.
4.01  Determine that an object will continue in its state of motion unless acted upon by a net outside force (Newton's First Law of Motion, The Law of Inertia).
4.02  Assess, measure and calculate the conditions required to maintain a body in a state of static equilibrium.
4.03  Assess, measure, and calculate the relationship among the force acting on a body, the mass of the body, and the nature of the acceleration produced (Newton's Second Law of Motion).
4.04  Analyze and mathematically describe forces as interactions between bodies (Newton's Third Law of Motion).
4.05  Assess the independence of the vector components of forces.
4.06  Investigate, measure, and analyze the nature and magnitude of frictional forces.
4.07  Assess and calculate the nature and magnitude of gravitational forces (Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation).
COMPETENCY GOAL 5:  The learner will build an understanding of impulse and momentum.
5.01  Assess the vector nature of momentum and its relation to the mass and velocity of an object.
5.02  Compare and contrast impulse and momentum.
5.03  Analyze the factors required to produce a change in momentum.
5.04  Analyze one-dimensional interactions between objects and recognize that the total momentum is conserved in both collision and recoil situations.
5.05  Assess real world applications of the impulse and momentum, including but not limited to, sports and transportation.
COMPETENCY GOAL 6:  The learner will develop an understanding of energy as the ability to cause change.

6.01 Investigate and analyze energy storage and transfer mechanisms:
• Gravitational potential energy.

6.01 Investigate and analyze energy storage and transfer mechanisms:
• Elastic potential energy.

6.01 Investigate and analyze energy storage and transfer mechanisms:
• Thermal energy.

6.01 Investigate and analyze energy storage and transfer mechanisms:
• Kinetic energy.
6.02  Analyze, evaluate, and apply the principle of conservation of energy.

6.03 Analyze, evaluate, and measure the transfer of energy by a force.
• Work.

6.03 Analyze, evaluate, and measure the transfer of energy by a force.
• Power.

6.04 Design and conduct investigations of:
• Mechanical energy.

6.04 Design and conduct investigations of:
• Power
COMPETENCY GOAL 7:  The learner will develop and understanding of wave motion and the wave nature of sound and light.

7.01 Analyze, investigate, and evaluate the relationship among the characteristics of waves:
• Wavelength.

7.01 Analyze, investigate, and evaluate the relationship among the characteristics of waves:
• Frequency.

7.01 Analyze, investigate, and evaluate the relationship among the characteristics of waves:
• Period.

7.01 Analyze, investigate, and evaluate the relationship among the characteristics of waves:
• Amplitude.
7.02  Describe the behavior of waves in various media.

7.03 Analyze the behavior of waves at boundaries between media:
• Reflection, including the Law of Reflection.

7.03 Analyze the behavior of waves at boundaries between media:
• Refraction, including Snell's Law.
7.04  Analyze the relationship between the phenomena of interference and the principle of superposition.
7.05  Analyze the frequency and wavelength of sound produced by a moving source (the Doppler Effect).
COMPETENCY GOAL 8:  The learner will build an understanding of static electricity and direct current electrical circuits.
8.01  Analyze the nature of electrical charges.• Investigate the electrical charging of objects due to transfer of charge.

8.01 Analyze the nature of electrical charges.
• Investigate the conservation of electric charge.

8.01 Analyze the nature of electrical charges.
• Analyze the relationship among force, charge and distance summarized in Coulomb's Law.
8.02  Analyze and measure the relationship among potential difference, current, and resistance in a direct current circuit.

8.03 Analyze and measure the relationship among current, voltage, and resistance in circuits.
• Series.

8.03 Analyze and measure the relationship among current, voltage, and resistance in circuits.
• Parallel.

8.03 Analyze and measure the relationship among current, voltage, and resistance in circuits.
• Series-parallel combinations.
8.04  Analyze and measure the nature of power in an electrical circuit.
